intro: Cracca incana, commonly known as the hoary cracca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage due to dense pubescence. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the cooler months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Cracca incana is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
